physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination at age 14 years showed macrodactyly of the great toes, long thumbs, an arm span to height ratio of 0.9, and a positive 'thumb sign' without other signs of Marfan syndrome.

Two daughters had markedly long great toes, ankle valgus, and long thumbs with a positive thumb sign. Skeletal surveys of the girls demonstrated pseudo-epiphyses of the mid- and proximal phalanges in hands and feet.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The growth curve of the eldest daughter shows progressive growth acceleration until the age of 4.5 years up to a height of +2 SDS.
